name: Nairobi National Park
description: Located just 7km from the city center, Nairobi National Park is a unique wildlife sanctuary where you can spot lions, giraffes, zebras, and more against the backdrop of the city skyline.
tips: Bring binoculars, wear neutral colors, and hire a guide for the best experience.

name: Giraffe Centre
description: A sanctuary for the endangered Rothschild Giraffe where visitors can feed these gentle giants from an elevated platform. It's an educational and interactive experience perfect for families.
tips: Bring hand sanitizer and be ready to get some giraffe saliva on your hands during feeding!

name: David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust
description: An elephant orphanage rescuing and rehabilitating orphaned elephants. Visit during feeding time to see baby elephants being bottle-fed and playing in the mud.
best_time: Arrive by 10:30 AM to get a good viewing spot
tips: Consider adopting an elephant to support their conservation work.

name: Nairobi National Museum
description: Explore Kenya's rich cultural and natural heritage through ethnographic and paleontological exhibits, including prehistoric finds from the famous archaeologist Louis Leakey.
tips: Combine with a visit to the Snake Park and Botanical Gardens on the same grounds.

name: Karen Blixen Museum
description: The former home of 'Out of Africa' author Karen Blixen, now converted into a museum showcasing colonial life in Kenya and the history of the Danish baroness.
best_time: Afternoons when the light is best for photos
tips: Consider reading 'Out of Africa' before visiting to enhance your experience.

name: Karura Forest
description: An urban forest oasis with hiking trails, waterfalls, caves, and abundant wildlife. Perfect for outdoor activities like hiking, cycling, and picnics away from the city hustle.
tips: Rent a bike at the entrance for a different way to explore the forest.

name: Bomas of Kenya
description: Experience traditional Kenyan dance, music, and cultural performances. The complex features replicas of traditional homes from various Kenyan tribes.
tips: Arrive by 2:00 PM to get good seats for the afternoon performance.

name: KICC Rooftop
description: The Kenyatta International Convention Centre's helipad offers breathtaking 360-degree views of Nairobi's skyline, especially beautiful at sunset.
tips: Bring a camera with a wide-angle lens for the best panoramic shots.

name: Nairobi Railway Museum
description: Discover the history of Kenya's railways with vintage locomotives, photographs, and memorabilia from the famous 'Lunatic Express' that connected Mombasa to Lake Victoria.
tips: Ask for a guided tour to get the most out of your visit.

name: Nairobi Arboretum
description: A serene 30-hectare forest garden with over 350 tree species, walking paths, and picnic areas. Popular for jogging, bird watching, and peaceful relaxation.
tips: Bring a blanket and pack a picnic to enjoy under the trees.

name: GP Karting
description: Race around a professional go-kart track with high-speed electric karts. Suitable for beginners and experienced drivers, with options for children and adults.
tips: Wear closed shoes and comfortable clothes. Book in advance on weekends.

name: Mamba Village
description: East Africa's largest crocodile farm with feeding demonstrations and a chance to see hundreds of Nile crocodiles up close. Also features horse riding, botanical gardens, and restaurants.
tips: Combine with a visit to other Karen attractions for a full day out.

name: The Village Market
description: An upscale shopping mall with over 150 stores, restaurants, a waterpark, and a vibrant Maasai craft market every Friday. Popular with expats and diplomats.
tips: Bring cash for bargaining at the craft market, and be ready to negotiate prices.

name: Hell's Gate National Park
description: A unique park where you can walk, cycle, or drive among wildlife, explore dramatic gorges, natural hot springs, and rock formations that inspired The Lion King's Pride Rock.
best_time: Early morning start for a day trip
tips: Rent bikes at the entrance and bring plenty of water and sun protection.

name: Maasai Market
description: A colorful open-air market selling traditional African crafts, jewelry, clothing, and souvenirs. The market rotates to different locations throughout the week.
tips: Bargain hard - start at around 50% of the initial asking price, and be prepared to walk away.

name: Nairobi Safari Walk
description: A raised wooden boardwalk that allows visitors to see wildlife in near-natural habitats. Perfect for an educational walk to observe animals and birds up close.
tips: Can be combined with a visit to the Animal Orphanage next door.

name: Giraffe Manor
description: An exclusive boutique hotel where Rothschild's giraffes visit morning and evening, poking their heads through windows for treats. One of Nairobi's most Instagram-worthy experiences.
hours: For overnight guests only (exterior viewing permitted)
best_time: Overnight stay required for full experience
tips: Book 6-12 months in advance, or visit the adjacent Giraffe Centre for a similar experience.

name: Nairobi Mamba Aquapark
description: Nairobi's largest water park featuring slides, wave pools, and water activities for all ages. A refreshing escape from the city heat.
tips: Bring your own towels and a change of clothes; lockers are available for rent.

name: Ngong Hills
description: A series of hills offering panoramic views of Nairobi on one side and the Great Rift Valley on the other. Popular for hiking, picnics, and paragliding.
tips: Hire a local guide for safety, and bring warm clothing as it can get windy at the top.

name: Kitengela Hot Glass
description: Watch skilled artisans create stunning glass art pieces using traditional techniques. Visitors can tour the workshop, make their own glass piece, and purchase unique souvenirs.
best_time: Mornings when glassblowers are most active
tips: Call ahead to confirm demonstrations, and allow time to explore the unique mosaic garden.
